results.title: Men and Masculinity
results.brief_description: A Two Part documentary that examines the changing roles of men in our society. Part 1, “Men and Masculinity”, looks at social conditioning and the image of a stereotypical male. Part 2, titled “Men and Intimacy”, looks at men and their personal relationships.

results.title: Men against the ice
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The conquest of the Artic Sea, beginning with attempts by early seafarers to thread their way through dangerous channels in search of a north-west passage across the North American Continent. Exploration by sea and air, right up to most recent developments. A forecast is made by Michael Marsden of the Artic Institute of North America. He sees the atomic-powered submarine paving the way for the industrial development of oil recourses in the Arctic.

results.title: Men & women in the business: the gender clash within the workplace
results.brief_description: Using Canada as an example, this video presents an informative look at the interaction between males and females in the workplace. It uses a seminar on communication between the sexes held with the Bank of Commerce- CIBC. They uncover issues such as the clash between male and female culture, gender differences and expectations, gender gripe lists of the opposite sex, how men and women listen differently, male confusion over a changed workplace and the need to change the traditional male culture of the organisation. The seminar proves to be useful to the organisation and they feel better equipped to deal with gender differences in the workplace.

results.title: Memphis Belle
results.creator_credit: Michael Caton-Jones, Catherine Wyler, David Puttnam and Bountiful Company Ltd
results.brief_description: The Memphis Belle is a B-17 World War II bomber, piloted by a young crew of ten men on dangerous bombing raids into Europe. Thus far they have flown 24 perilous missions, they are about to embark on mission 25 - a daylight raid on Bremen that is there most dangerous to date, and the one thing that stands between them and home. The expectations for success were high, as completing the 25th mission would earn the crew the prestigious position of being the first crew to complete all 25 missions in the 8th Airforce. Cinemagoers first saw the exploits of the Memphis Belle in a 1944 documentary by William Wyler (also available in the collection). Using this documentary as inspiration, the producers David Puttnam and Catherine Wyler embarked on a mission to produce a film that included real B-17’s and other vintage planes, as well as impressive models and authentic footage as a backdrop to the story of friendship, action and heroics. The cast includes Matthew Modine, Eric Stoltz, Tate Donovan, D. B. Sweeney, Billy Zane, Sean Astin, Harry Connick Jnr, Reed Edward Diamond, Coutney Gains and Neil Giuntoli.
